verses.text: I \add am\add* the \w rose|strong="H2261"\w* of \w Sharon|strong="H8289"\w*, \add and\add* the \w lily|strong="H7799"\w* of the \w valleys|strong="H6010"\w*.
As the \w lily|strong="H7799"\w* among \w thorns|strong="H2336"\w*, so \add is\add* my \w love|strong="H7474"\w* among the \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w*.

As the apple \w tree|strong="H8598"\w* among the \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* of the \w wood|strong="H3293"\w*, so \add is\add* my \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w* among the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*. I \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* down under his \w shadow|strong="H6738"\w* with great \w delight|strong="H2530"\w*, and his \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* \add was\add* \w sweet|strong="H4966"\w* to my \w taste|strong="H2441"\w*.\f + \fr 2.3 \ft I sat…: Heb. I delighted and sat down, etc\f*\f + \fr 2.3 \ft taste: Heb. palate\f*

He \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* me to the \w banqueting|strong="H3196"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and his \w banner|strong="H1714"\w* over me \add was\add* \w love|strong="H0160"\w*.\f + \fr 2.4 \ft banqueting…: Heb. house of wine\f*

\w Stay|strong="H5564"\w* me with \w flagons|strong="H0809"\w*, \w comfort|strong="H7502"\w* me with \w apples|strong="H8598"\w*: for I \add am\add* \w sick|strong="H2470"\w* of \w love|strong="H0160"\w*.\f + \fr 2.5 \ft comfort…: Heb. straw me with apples\f*
His left \w hand|strong="H8040"\w* \add is\add* under my \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, and his right \w hand|strong="H3225"\w* doth \w embrace|strong="H2263"\w* me.

I \w charge|strong="H7650"\w* you, O ye \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, by the \w roes|strong="H6643"\w*, \w and|strong="H0176"\w* by the \w hinds|strong="H0355"\w* of the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, that ye stir not \w up|strong="H5782"\w*, nor \w awake|strong="H5782"\w* \add my\add* \w love|strong="H0160"\w*, till he \w please|strong="H2654"\w*.\f + \fr 2.7 \ft I charge…: Heb. I adjure you\f*

¶ The \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of my \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w*! behold, he \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w* \w leaping|strong="H1801"\w* upon the \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w*, \w skipping|strong="H7092"\w* upon the \w hills|strong="H1389"\w*.

My \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w* is \w like|strong="H1819"\w* a \w roe|strong="H6643"\w* or a \w young|strong="H6082"\w* \w hart|strong="H0354"\w*: behold, he \w standeth|strong="H5975"\w* \w behind|strong="H0310"\w* our \w wall|strong="H3796"\w*, he looketh \w forth|strong="H7688"\w* at the \w windows|strong="H2474"\w*, \w shewing|strong="H6692"\w* himself through the \w lattice|strong="H2762"\w*.\f + \fr 2.9 \ft shewing…: Heb. flourishing\f*

My \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w* \w spake|strong="H6030"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto me, Rise \w up|strong="H6965"\w*, my \w love|strong="H7474"\w*, my fair \w one|strong="H3303"\w*, and come \w away|strong="H3212"\w*.
For, lo, the \w winter|strong="H5638"\w* is \w past|strong="H5674"\w*, the \w rain|strong="H1653"\w* is \w over|strong="H2498"\w* \add and\add* \w gone|strong="H1980"\w*;

The \w flowers|strong="H5339"\w* \w appear|strong="H7200"\w* on the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*; the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* of the \w singing|strong="H2158"\w* \add of birds\add* is \w come|strong="H5060"\w*, and the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w turtle|strong="H8449"\w* is \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* in our \w land|strong="H0776"\w*;

The fig \w tree|strong="H8384"\w* putteth \w forth|strong="H2590"\w* her green \w figs|strong="H6291"\w*, and the \w vines|strong="H1612"\w* \add with\add* the tender \w grape|strong="H5563"\w* \w give|strong="H5414"\w* a \add good\add* \w smell|strong="H7381"\w*. \w Arise|strong="H6965"\w*, my \w love|strong="H7474"\w*, my fair \w one|strong="H3303"\w*, and come \w away|strong="H3212"\w*.

¶ O my \w dove|strong="H3123"\w*, \add that art\add* in the \w clefts|strong="H2288"\w* of the \w rock|strong="H5553"\w*, in the \w secret|strong="H5643"\w* \add places\add* of the \w stairs|strong="H4095"\w*, let me \w see|strong="H7200"\w* thy \w countenance|strong="H4758"\w*, let me \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* thy \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*; for \w sweet|strong="H6156"\w* \add is\add* thy \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, and thy \w countenance|strong="H4758"\w* \add is\add* \w comely|strong="H5000"\w*.

\w Take|strong="H0270"\w* us the \w foxes|strong="H7776"\w*, the \w little|strong="H6996"\w* \w foxes|strong="H7776"\w*, that \w spoil|strong="H2254"\w* the \w vines|strong="H3754"\w*: for our \w vines|strong="H3754"\w* \add have\add* tender \w grapes|strong="H5563"\w*.
¶ My \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w* \add is\add* mine, and I \add am\add* his: he \w feedeth|strong="H7462"\w* among the \w lilies|strong="H7799"\w*.

Until the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w break|strong="H6315"\w*, and the \w shadows|strong="H6752"\w* flee \w away|strong="H5127"\w*, \w turn|strong="H5437"\w*, my \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w*, and be thou \w like|strong="H1819"\w* a \w roe|strong="H6643"\w* or a \w young|strong="H6082"\w* \w hart|strong="H0354"\w* upon the \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w* of \w Bether|strong="H1336"\w*.\f + \fr 2.17 \ft of Bether: or, of division\f*
